item.title: Incompatible Types?
item.dc:creator: @vato vato
item.description:
@vato wrote:

Hi, i was trying to add God Capes to my server (Dodian type), and while doing this, i tried to declare this method…

public void TakeCape(String god, int reqSkillNum, int lvlReq, int XPSkillNum, int XPamount, int item, int itemAmount, int delay, int emote) { if(theifTimer = 0) { if(playerLevel[reqSkillNum] >= lvlReq) { setAnimation(emote); sM("You bow down to "+god); sM("You recieve the cape of "+god+"."); addItem(item, itemAmount); theifTimer = delay; } else if(playerLevel[reqSkillNum] < lvlReq) { sM("You need a "+statName[reqSkillNum]+" level of "+lvlReq+" to pray to "+god+"."); } } }

so then, i saved, compiled and here is the error…

client.java:169: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if(theifTimer = 0) { ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

I tried declaring it as a boolean, and it said

client.java:34: incompatible types found : int required: boolean public boolean theifTimer = 0; ^ client.java:169: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if(theifTimer = 0) { ^ client.java:175: incompatible types found : int required: boolean theifTimer = delay; ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . .

If someone could at least “nudge” me in the right direction, i would be grateful.
Thanks for any help!

Read full topic
